From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To specify the maximum number of entries retained in the configuration log, use the **logging size** command in configuration change logger configuration mode. To reset the default value, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: The maximum number of entries retained in the configuration log. Valid values range from 1 to 1000. The default value is 100 entries.

Examples: The following example shows how to specify that the configuration log may have a maximum of 200 <entries>:

The following example shows how to clear the configuration log by reducing the log size to 1, then resetting the log size to the desired value. Only the most recent configuration log file will be saved.
ExtraInfo: When the configuration log is full, the oldest log entry will be removed every time a new entry is added.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)If a new log size is specified that is smaller than the current log size, the oldest entries will be immediately purged until the new log size is satisfied, regardless of the age of the log entries.---

RelatedCmds.description: Suppresses the display of password information in configuration log files.
Enters configuration change logger configuration mode.
Enables the logging of configuration changes.
Enables the sending of notifications of configuration changes to a remote syslog.
Displays entries from the configuration log.
